          About this item

          • Get better sound from your TVThe Bose Solo Soundbar Series 2 is a Bluetooth TV speaker that makes every word easier to understand and gives you better sound from your TV with better voice clarity from the improved Dialogue Mode. Inside, there are two full-range drivers angled for wide, spatial sound.
          • Easy-to-use and compact Bluetooth soundbarThis soundbar stands at just under 7 cm (3") tall and can fit under most TVs. A high-quality steel wall bracket is included to mount the soundbar flush to the wall. Easily mount your soundbar on the wall for a minimalist look and use the simplified remote for quick navigation. Small LED lights on the front indicate when certain features are enabled.
          • "Updated design with new grille colour and logo treatmentThe updated Solo Soundbar Series 2 features a black grille for a more modern aesthetic with a fresh look and feel."
          • More claritysoundbar for voice clarity. In the improved Dialogue Mode, the Bose Solo Soundbar Series 2 makes every word easier to understand without having to adjust the volume. Simply press the Dialogue Mode button on the included remote to enable.
          • Built-in Dolby decodingThe Solo Soundbar Series 2 features built-in Dolby decoding to create a richer, more satisfying listening experience with remarkable authenticity.
          • More musicBluetooth soundbar. The Bose Solo Soundbar Series 2 also has Bluetooth streaming, so you can listen to what you want, when you want, with Bluetooth connection to your device. Press the Bluetooth button on the included remote to pair a device and wirelessly play music, podcasts and more through your soundbar.
          • More bassAnd while the Bose Solo Soundbar Series 2 delivers surprisingly rich and deep sound for a soundbar of its size, you can press the BASS button on the remote for some added depth.
          • Easy to set up. Easy to use.A single connection to your TV via an optical audio cable (included) ensures easy set-up, so you can start using your Bose Solo Soundbar Series 2 right away.
          • The Bose Solo Soundbar Series 2 is a compact Bluetooth soundbar that makes every word easier to understand and gives you better sound from your TV with improved Dialogue Mode and built-in Dolby decoding. Designed to be easy to use, with a single connection that has you up and running in no time. And with Bluetooth connectivity, you can wirelessly stream your favourite music or podcasts.

          From the manufacturer

          Bose Solo Soundbar Series 2

          Clear sound. Make easy.

          The Bose Solo Soundbar Series 2 is the compact TV speaker with Bluetooth connectivity that gives you clear and natural sound from your TV and makes every word of dialogue easier to understand.

          Simple, one-step setup.

          Clear, quality sound shouldnt be difficult. Thats why Bose kept things simple. Just one connection from your TV to this soundbar will have you unboxed and on your sofa watching your favourite shows and movies in no time.

          Previous page

          1. Enable Dialogue Mode on the remote to analyse what youre watching and further enhance speech.

          2. With Bluetooth compatibility, you can wirelessly play music and podcasts through your soundbar.

          3. Need a boost? You can press the BASS button on the included remote for some extra depth.

          How customer reviews and ratings work

          Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings, help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

          To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we dont use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyses reviews to verify trustworthiness.

          • Lorna
            5.0 out of 5 stars I'm a happy bunny!
            Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 October 2024
            Verified Purchase
            I received my Bose soundbar today and so far I'm very impressed. It was very simple to set up, when I found out where the outlet was on the back of my TV. Once I got used to the remote control, I played with it on various programmes, and switched from dialogue to normal several times to compare....there is no comparison! I'm one of those people who when watching a film is continually saying "what did he/she say?" Which is why I went for a soundbar. Also I also can't stand music in programmes drowning out the dialogue. I have watched the Big bang theory so many times I virtually know the scripts, and today, I watched an episode and during a funny scene, I suddenly heard an audience member laugh and then say oh nooo.....never heard that before. Also when people applaud, it doesn't sound as if they're clapping with gloves on! On the whole its not one with all the bells and whistles, but its perfect, simple to set up, good looking, and its now making my viewing a pleasure, crisp, clear voices, no sudden crash of music drowning out speech. Some people are mentioning that a lack of lights on the unit is a small let down, but hey, when I use the volume control, I don't need lights to tell me its working, I can hear it! I didnt realise what I was missing until I bought this unit, and I'm so glad I did. Its a perfect piece of kit, neat and unobtrusive and the sound quality is great. If you're new to soundbars as I am, its a perfect entry level and great value for money....and it's Bose....you can't go wrong.

            EDIT... after a few days use, I'm still delighted on the dialogue improvement, and the fact that the background music is exactly that, quiet in the background. But, after a few days use, and this is just my preference, I'm finding the bass a bit too much, I've tried many times to turn it right down, to no avail. I really can't stand that deep thrumming bass sound, never have, so this is the 1 niggle that is spoiling this soundbar experience for me. So if like me you don't like a deep bass, this might not be for you. I'm already thinking of upgrading, but can't afford it yet! Apart from the bass problem, I still like the product, but as most Netflix/TV programmes/films have a ton of music playing constantly during the programme, its annoying with the heavy bass. I just hope its not annoying the neighbours! BTW, the Bluetooth connections to my laptop and phone were a doddle, and I love listening to my music without having to confine them to a set of speakers. So to sum up, love the product, hate the bass!

            5.0 out of 5 stars Good, ignore the youtube reviews.
            Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 August 2025
            Verified Purchase
            Initially I wasn't that impressed. However, I read the manual to adjust it a bit and it's great.

            A few things to note, the youtube reviews are not great. They are usually by people comparing it to far more expensive equipment.
            Like a Ferarri fanatic, reviewing a ford fiesta and saying its slow.
            It's great for it's price, there is a Sony one that is around the same money and supposed to be better, I chose this as its quite compact and sits nicely below my TV in the centre (the middle third of a 55inch TV).
            It has an optical connection or Bluetooth (no hdmi), meaning two remotes, although I can sync it and adjust the volume with my LG tv remote.
            It's loud enough for me to have not turned it up to its highest.
            The bass is good and adjustable.
            Its party trick is the clear voice button that solves the problem of not being able to hear what people are saying in some content and it works flawlessly.

            After watching countless youtube reviewers say its not very good, I can tell you after a month of use it's a decent bit of kit that looks nice and has the bose logo.
            It will be fine if you are someone not totally obsessed with sound systems.

          • Richard
            5.0 out of 5 stars Probably the best you can buy in this, and higher price brackets!
            Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 February 2025
            Verified Purchase
            For clarity, I only write reviews when I think something is either really bad or really good. Firstly to confirm, the majority of the viewpoints already offered are indeed accurate, For the price this compact little sound bar packs a lot of punch and is acoustically excellent! Voice clarity, bass response and volume are all excellent, see below..

            Sound quality: firstly the bass! I can't quite believe how punchy this thing is! BOSE are of course known for this, but even still it manages to crank it out even at high volumes! Mids and hight are also bright without being harsh. Very impressed.

            For movies & TV: - This replaces an Orbit Sound system that comprised of the sound bar and bluetooth sub-woofer. So often we had to have the volume way too high simply to be able to hear the dialogue. With this, clarity is off the scale, its not even in the same vicinity, and that without using the voice boost function. All this without compromising the bass. Impressed!

            For music: - I had some idea that this is where it might fall down, thinking it was tuned for TV and video... Nope! sounds amazing and if anything the bass is even deeper.

            Setup is literally plug n play, works like any other bluetooth speaker, could not be easier!

            My one gripe; as I am sure has already been mentioned, is that there is no HDMI port, connectivity is either optical (recommended) or analogue via 3mm jack or coaxial. This is a small price to pay with this quality at this price though.

            I am so impressed I am considering buying another!

            Reviewed in Germany on 2 October 2025
            Verified Purchase
            Bose Solo Soundbar kompakter Klangriese mit klarem Sound

            Ich nutze die Bose Solo Soundbar jetzt seit mehreren Wochen und bin rundum zufrieden mit dem Gert. Die Soundbar ist kompakt und unauffllig, passt daher auch gut in kleinere Wohnzimmer oder unter den Fernseher, ohne viel Platz wegzunehmen.

            Design und Verarbeitung

            Das Design ist schlicht, modern und hochwertig verarbeitet. Die Soundbar wirkt stabil, die Materialien fhlen sich wertig an. Die Bedienung mit der Fernbedienung ist intuitiv, alle Tasten sind gut erreichbar und beschriftet.

            Klangqualitt

            Fr die Gre liefert die Bose Solo Soundbar einen berraschend klaren und ausgewogenen Klang. Stimmen werden sehr deutlich wiedergegeben, was besonders bei Serien und Nachrichten angenehm ist. Die Bsse sind zwar nicht so druckvoll wie bei greren oder separaten Subwoofern, aber fr den Alltag vollkommen ausreichend und gut abgestimmt.

            Anschlsse und Bedienung

            Die Verbindung zum Fernseher funktionierte bei mir problemlos, sowohl per optischem Kabel als auch via Bluetooth. Die Einrichtung war schnell erledigt, die Soundbar wurde sofort erkannt. Auch die Steuerung per TV-Fernbedienung ist mglich, was den Bedienkomfort erhht.

            Gre und Einsatzbereich

            Ideal fr kleinere bis mittelgroe Rume, in denen man den Fernseherklang deutlich verbessern mchte, ohne ein aufwndiges Surround-System aufzubauen. Die Soundbar ist unauffllig und leicht zu platzieren.

            Preis-Leistung

            Der Preis ist im hheren Segment angesiedelt, was bei Bose-Produkten blich ist. Die Qualitt, der Klang und die Verarbeitungsqualitt rechtfertigen den Preis jedoch in meinen Augen.

            Fazit:
            Die Bose Solo Soundbar ist eine hervorragende Lsung, um den Fernsehton deutlich zu verbessern besonders, wenn man eine kompakte, einfache und qualitativ hochwertige Soundbar sucht. Klare Stimmen, ausgewogener Klang und einfache Bedienung machen das Gert zu einer Empfehlung wert.
